availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Lawrence Waring (Greenup County, Kentucky, resident and farmer.)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, resident and farmer. Greenup County native. Son of C. H. Waring and Mary Waring. Married to Hannah Spangler Waring. Father of Charles W. Waring and Anna P. Waring. Resident in Greenup County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Greenup County in 1850. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860. Employed George H. Fullerton as a minister in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District No. 1, p. 222B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District No. 1, p. 248.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 713.
“James Lawrence Waring,” The Peabody Gazette-Herald, January 12, 1911.
"James L. Waring (1825-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial 9247012, accessed December 2, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9247012.
